text: For operational time series use cases,
like monitoring infrastructure reliability,
measuring video quality, and securing public API calls,
customers often choose Influx DB for its open source APIs
and single digit millisecond response time.
Customers who want to use the service
oftentimes need to self-manage their databases,
spending considerable time and resources
on undifferentiated database administration tasks.
Amazon Time Stream for Influx DB is a fast, reliable,
and fully managed database service,
making it easy to set up, operate,
and scale Influx DB deployments on the cloud.
You can get started in minutes with cost efficient
and re-sizable hardware capacity.
It manages time consuming, administrative tasks,
such as software installation and upgrades,
storage management, replication for high availability,
and backups.
This creates more opportunities for you
to focus on your applications.
With Time Stream for Influx DB,
Amazon Time Stream now provides a complete solution
for your time series workloads,
from queries with single digit millisecond response times
to serverless time series processing at petabyte scale.
Get the low latency processing you need
with Amazon Time Stream for Influx DB.
